column4: Amazon launches Prime Video globally  leaves out China
column5: Amazon.com Inc  launched its video-streaming service  Prime Video  in nearly every country except China on Wednesday  in its biggest challenge yet to Netflix Inc .

column4: U.S. fines American Airlines $1.6 million for violating tarmac delay rule
column5: WASHINGTON American Airlines  will pay a record-matching $1.6 million fine for violating a rule that prohibits long tarmac delays  the U.S. Transportation Department said on Wednesday.

column4: Caesars unit's bank lenders need more time to resolve dispute: lawyer
column5: CHICAGO Bank lenders of Caesars Entertainment Corp's  bankrupt operating unit need more time to resolve a dispute over the terms of their recovery  a lawyer said in court on Wednesday.

column4: Japan legalizes casinos  sets stage for large-scale investment
column5: TOKYO Japan's parliament passed a law on Thursday to legalize casinos  ending 15 years of political argument and opening the way for projects that combine high-stakes gambling with hotels  shopping and conference space. | Video

column4: U.S. jury sides with Arista over Cisco in copyright battle
column5: SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. jury on Wednesday handed Arista Networks Inc a major win in a wide-ranging legal battle against Cisco Systems Inc  ruling that Arista owed no damages over Cisco's claims of copyright infringement.

column4: Diamondback to expand in Permian with $2.43 billion acreage buy
column5: Oil and gas producer Diamondback Energy Inc  said on Wednesday it would pay $2.43 billion to buy acreage in Texas' Permian Basin  adding to a string of deals in the prolific shale field.

column4: LPC-Equinix doubles acquisition loan to €1 billion
column5: LONDON US data center operator Equinix  has doubled the size of a leveraged loan it is raising to back its acquisition of data centers from Verizon Communications   increasing it to €1bn and tightening pricing following overwhelming investor demand  banking sources said on Wednesday.

column4: Express Scripts sees no let-up in drug pricing chatter
column5: Express Scripts Holding Co   the largest pharmacy benefit manager in the United States  said drug price inflation would likely be restrained going into 2017 and that scrutiny into pricing strategies was here to stay.

column4: Grifols to buy Hologic's stake in blood screening JV for $1.85 billion
column5: Spain's Grifols SA   which develops plasma protein therapies  said it would buy U.S. medical device maker Hologic Inc's  interest in their blood screening joint venture for $1.85 billion in cash.

column4: Gulfport to buy acreage in Oklahoma's SCOOP for $1.85 billion
column5: Gulfport Energy Corp  said it would buy acreage in Oklahoma's SCOOP region from a privately held company for $1.85 billion.

column4: Grifols to buy Hologic's stake in blood screening JV for $1.85 billion
column5: Spain's Grifols SA   which develops plasma protein therapies  said it would buy U.S. medical device maker Hologic Inc's  interest in their blood screening joint venture for $1.85 billion in cash.

column4: Intercept Pharma's liver drug wins conditional EU approval
column5: Intercept Pharmaceuticals Inc said its liver drug received conditional approval from the European Commission to treat patients with primary biliary cholangitis (PBC)  a rare liver condition.

column4: Mondelez unaware of any Kraft Heinz approach: sources
column5: Mondelez International Inc  has not heard from Kraft Heinz Co  about any potential acquisition  people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday  after Swiss magazine Bilanz reported that the latter was planning a bid.

column4: Amazon launches Prime Video globally  leaves out China
column5: Amazon.com Inc  launched its video-streaming service  Prime Video  in nearly every country except China on Wednesday  in its biggest challenge yet to Netflix Inc .

column4: Sunrun expands home battery storage to California
column5: U.S. solar company Sunrun Inc on Wednesday said it was expanding its home battery storage offering to homeowners in California after enjoying better-than-expected demand for the product in Hawaii.

column4: Uber  SpaceX/Tesla  and PepsiCo execs join Trump business council
column5: WASHINGTON Elon Musk  the chairman and chief executive of SpaceX and Tesla as well as Uber Technologies CEO and co-founder Travis Kalanick and PepsiCo Chairman and CEO Indra Nooyi have joined U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's advisory council  Trump's transition team said on Wednesday.

column4: Mondelez unaware of any Kraft Heinz approach: sources
column5: Mondelez International Inc  has not heard from Kraft Heinz Co  about any potential acquisition  people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday  after Swiss magazine Bilanz reported that the latter was planning a bid.

column4: Former UK PM Brown calls for Murdoch's Sky deal to be delayed
column5: LONDON Former Prime Minister Gordon Brown urged Britain to delay Rupert Murdoch's proposed deal to buy European pay-TV group Sky  until the government completes an inquiry into a phone hacking scandal  the Guardian said on Wednesday.

column4: New accusations against former Fox News head Ailes in lawsuit
column5: New sexual harassment accusations against former Fox News network chief Roger Ailes were revealed in a lawsuit filed against 21st Century Fox on Monday.

column4: Former UK PM Brown calls for Murdoch's Sky deal to be delayed
column5: LONDON Former Prime Minister Gordon Brown urged Britain to delay Rupert Murdoch's proposed deal to buy European pay-TV group Sky  until the government completes an inquiry into a phone hacking scandal  the Guardian said on Wednesday.

column4: New accusations against former Fox News head Ailes in lawsuit
column5: New sexual harassment accusations against former Fox News network chief Roger Ailes were revealed in a lawsuit filed against 21st Century Fox on Monday.

column4: Alaska Air completes Virgin America acquisition
column5: Alaska Air Group Inc  said on Wednesday it completed its $2.6 billion acquisition of Virgin America Inc  to become the fifth-largest U.S. carrier.

column4: U.S. jury sides with Arista over Cisco in copyright battle
column5: SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. jury on Wednesday handed Arista Networks Inc a major win in a wide-ranging legal battle against Cisco Systems Inc  ruling that Arista owed no damages over Cisco's claims of copyright infringement.

column4: Tax cuts can offset damage from higher U.S. rates: BlackRock's Rieder
column5: NEW YORK Top BlackRock Inc bond investor Rick Rieder on Wednesday said tax cuts would help the U.S. economy withstand even sharply higher interest rates.

column4: CNPC plans to cut headquarters staff by 20 percent in efficiency drive: microblog
column5: BEIJING China National Petroleum Company [CNPET.UL] plans to cut staff at its Beijing headquarters by 20 percent  the company said in a post on its social media blog on Tuesday  the latest move in an efficiency drive by the country's top state energy group.

column4: U.S. gives final approval to Delta-Aeromexico venture
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. Transportation Department said on Wednesday it had granted final approval to an alliance agreement submitted by Delta Air Lines Inc  and Aeromexico .

column4: Factbox: Trump fills top jobs for his administration
column5: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump has chosen Republican Representative Ryan Zinke of Montana  a former Navy SEAL commander  as his interior secretary  a senior transition official said on Tuesday.

column4: Senate fight looms after Trump taps Exxon CEO as top U.S. diplomat
column5: WASHINGTON President-elect Donald Trump named the head of Exxon Mobil Corp  Rex Tillerson  as his choice for U.S. secretary of state on Tuesday and won backing from some Republican foreign policy figures ahead of a possible Senate fight over the oilman's ties to Russia. | Video

column4: Exxon's new boss will confront the end of empire
column5: CHICAGO/MADRID (Reuters Breakingviews) - Exxon Mobil's next chief executive will confront a weakened empire in 2017. With current boss Rex Tillerson selected as Donald Trump's secretary of state  likely successor Darren Woods will take charge of the $380 billion oil giant amid still-weak prices and falling reserves.

column4: Democrats enlist experts to scour Tillerson's business record
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. Senate Democrats plan to enlist accountants and legal experts to pore through the business records of Exxon Mobil Chief Executive Rex Tillerson  President-elect Donald Trump's pick for secretary of state  Democratic aides said. | Video

column4: GE sticks to $2 EPS target for 2018  sells more assets
column5: General Electric Co  on Wednesday renewed its forecast for strong earnings growth over the next two years despite weak energy markets  and said it expects to further build its 3-D printing and services businesses while selling other franchises.

column4: As good as it gets? Boutique banks look to grow beyond M&A
column5: Boutique investment banks have grabbed a record share of the global merger and acquisition fee pool off larger Wall Street rivals this year but their stock price performance is trailing bigger peers.

column4: GE to sell $3 billion industrial solutions business
column5: General Electric Co  said on Wednesday it would sell its $3 billion industrial solutions business  which makes electrical equipment  as part of a push to focus on its core businesses.

column4: Goldman names Solomon  Schwartz as Cohn's successors
column5: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  promoted company veterans David Solomon and Harvey Schwartz as presidents and co-chief operating officers on Wednesday  setting up the two men to compete to replace Chief Executive Officer Lloyd Blankfein.

column4: JPMorgan  Goldman Sachs expected to lead Altice USA listing: sources
column5: LONDON Investment banks JPMorgan  and Goldman Sachs  are in pole position to be mandated to lead the initial public offering (IPO) of shares in Altice USA  three sources familiar with the matter said.

column4: Goldman Sachs expected to name Solomon  Schwartz as Cohn successors: WSJ
column5: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  is expected to elevate David Solomon and Harvey Schwartz to be top lieutenants to Chief Executive Lloyd Blankfein  according to a Wall Street Journal report on Tuesday citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Micro Focus shares lifted by surprise first-half revenue rise
column5: LONDON Micro Focus International   the British IT firm buying Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co's  software business  said it had made good progress in its first half-year  with better-than-expected revenue and earnings growth.

column4: HSBC launches special lending facility for start-ups in China's Pearl River Delta
column5: HONG KONG HSBC has launched a $290 million lending facility aimed at technology start-ups and other new industries in China's Pearl River Delta region  intensifying the battle for a slice of a business that is growing despite a slowing economy.

column4: HSBC launches special lending facility for start-ups in China's Pearl River Delta
column5: HONG KONG HSBC has launched a $290 million lending facility aimed at technology start-ups and other new industries in China's Pearl River Delta region  intensifying the battle for a slice of a business that is growing despite a slowing economy.

column4: HSBC launches special lending facility for start-ups in China's Pearl River Delta
column5: HONG KONG HSBC has launched a $290 million lending facility aimed at technology start-ups and other new industries in China's Pearl River Delta region  intensifying the battle for a slice of a business that is growing despite a slowing economy.

column4: American in Russia returns to face U.S. charges in JPMorgan hacking case
column5: NEW YORK An American was taken into U.S. custody on Wednesday after arriving from Russia to face charges that he helped orchestrate a massive computer hacking and fraud scheme that included an attack against JPMorgan Chase & Co  prosecutors said.

column4: JPMorgan  Goldman Sachs expected to lead Altice USA listing: sources
column5: LONDON Investment banks JPMorgan  and Goldman Sachs  are in pole position to be mandated to lead the initial public offering (IPO) of shares in Altice USA  three sources familiar with the matter said.

column4: Pfizer's Xtandi fails in progression trial vs. J&J's Zytiga
column5: A late-stage trial found that continuing treatment with Pfizer Inc's cancer drug Xtandi in addition to a regimen of Zytiga and a steroid worked no better than the two other drugs alone in patients with advanced prostate cancer whose disease had worsened  the company said on Wednesday.

column4: Actelion talking to Sanofi after J&J exit
column5: ZURICH/LONDON Switzerland's Actelion Ltd  is in talks with French drugmaker Sanofi  about a deal  sources said on Wednesday  after U.S. healthcare group Johnson & Johnson  abandoned efforts to buy the company. | Video

column4: Top Lyondell refining executives leaving before refinery sale: sources
column5: HOUSTON Two top U.S. refining executives are leaving LyondellBasell Industries as the company nears an agreement to sell its Houston refinery  sources familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

column4: Micro Focus shares lifted by surprise first-half revenue rise
column5: LONDON Micro Focus International   the British IT firm buying Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co's  software business  said it had made good progress in its first half-year  with better-than-expected revenue and earnings growth.

column4: Monsanto shareholders back Bayer deal  CEO hopeful of U.S. approval
column5: CHICAGO Shareholders of U.S. seeds and agrochemicals company Monsanto Co approved the company's $66 billion acquisition by Bayer AG on Tuesday  a deal that still requires regulatory approval to close as expected in late 2017.

column4: Trial of IMF's Lagarde hears that payout decision was rushed through
column5: PARIS A French ex-treasury official told a court trying IMF chief Christine Lagarde for negligence on Wednesday that he had been shocked at how quickly the government had given up on contesting a huge state payout to business tycoon Bernard Tapie in 2008.

column4: Uber  SpaceX/Tesla  and PepsiCo execs join Trump business council
column5: WASHINGTON Elon Musk  the chairman and chief executive of SpaceX and Tesla as well as Uber Technologies CEO and co-founder Travis Kalanick and PepsiCo Chairman and CEO Indra Nooyi have joined U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's advisory council  Trump's transition team said on Wednesday.

column4: Pfizer's Xtandi fails in progression trial vs. J&J's Zytiga
column5: A late-stage trial found that continuing treatment with Pfizer Inc's cancer drug Xtandi in addition to a regimen of Zytiga and a steroid worked no better than the two other drugs alone in patients with advanced prostate cancer whose disease had worsened  the company said on Wednesday.

column4: FDA approves Pfizer ointment for chronic itchy skin condition
column5: A Pfizer Inc  ointment to treat mild to moderate cases of the itchy skin condition eczema  or atopic dermatitis  won U.S. approval for use in patients aged two years and older  the Food and Drug Administration said on Wednesday.

column4: Actelion talking to Sanofi after J&J exit
column5: ZURICH/LONDON Switzerland's Actelion Ltd  is in talks with French drugmaker Sanofi  about a deal  sources said on Wednesday  after U.S. healthcare group Johnson & Johnson  abandoned efforts to buy the company. | Video

column4: Stone Energy files for bankruptcy to carry out debt cutting plan
column5: Stone Energy Corp filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy on Wednesday to eliminate about $1.2 billion in debt by transferring control of the offshore oil producer to its noteholders in the face of a two-year slump in energy prices.

column4: Venezuela ordered to pay steelmaker Tenaris $162 million for takeover
column5: BUENOS AIRES A World Bank tribunal ordered Venezuela to pay steelmaker Tenaris SA  $162 million for expropriating two investments in the country  according to a statement published by the Buenos Aires stock exchange on Wednesday.

column4: Trump team says Twitter too small to be included in tech meeting
column5: WASHINGTON President-elect Donald Trump left Twitter off the invitation list for a meeting of technology company executives on Wednesday because it is too small  a spokesman for his transition team told Reuters.

column4: LPC-Equinix doubles acquisition loan to €1 billion
column5: LONDON US data center operator Equinix  has doubled the size of a leveraged loan it is raising to back its acquisition of data centers from Verizon Communications   increasing it to €1bn and tightening pricing following overwhelming investor demand  banking sources said on Wednesday.

column4: LPC-Equinix doubles acquisition loan to €1 billion
column5: LONDON US data center operator Equinix  has doubled the size of a leveraged loan it is raising to back its acquisition of data centers from Verizon Communications   increasing it to €1bn and tightening pricing following overwhelming investor demand  banking sources said on Wednesday.

column4: SEC asks Wells Fargo to explain loan accounting practices
column5: The top U.S. securities regulator has questioned Wells Fargo & Co over its accounting for a roughly $20 billion portfolio of troubled loans.

column4: Wells Fargo fails 'living will' test  faces restrictions: U.S. regulators
column5: NEW YORK/WASHINGTON U.S. officials on Tuesday limited Wells Fargo & Co's  ability to grow its business  punishing the bank for not having a sufficient plan to protect markets in the case of bankruptcy.
